hauntedhouse

Class HauntedHouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • hauntedhouse.HauntedHouse

  • public class HauntedHouse
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HauntedHouse(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs and initialize a haunted house along Since the game always starts at the front door a frontDoor object would be created.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] deleteAllconenctions()
      Delete all connections to other rooms By calling this method going back to a previous room would be impossible

      Discard all items in a room After calling this method the user will not be allowed to pick another item.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> deleteConnection(int location)
      Takes a location as input and if the location is in the list of possible room destinations it will be deleted.
      int displayOptions(java.lang.Object[] options, int[] destinations, java.lang.String[] items, int room)
      Ask the user for a choice First, three things will be done: Check all possible connections available Check all possible items available Delete all connection to previous room If there are connections and items available, ask user if they want to stay or move to another room If there are no room connections but there are items available, ask user which item they want to pick If there are rooms available but no items, ask user to move to another room

    • Constructor Detail

      • HauntedHouse

        public HauntedHouse(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs and initialize a haunted house along Since the game always starts at the front door a frontDoor object would be created. Also, the current position will be stored.
        Parameters:
        name - player's name

      • deleteConnection

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> deleteConnection(int location)
        Takes a location as input and if the location is in the list of possible room destinations it will be deleted. Otherwise, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        location - connection to be deleted
        Returns:
        updated list of rooms that can be visited

      • deleteAllconenctions

        public int[] deleteAllconenctions()
        Delete all connections to other rooms By calling this method going back to a previous room would be impossible
        Returns:
        an empty array of connections

      • deleteAllItems

        public java.lang.String[] deleteAllItems()
        Discard all items in a room After calling this method the user will not be allowed to pick another item. Thus, the only option available will be to move to another room
        Returns:
        an empty array of items

      • openDoor

        public void openDoor(int roomPosition)
        Initialize a room object given its position
        Parameters:
        roomPosition - position of a given room

      • displayOptions

        public int displayOptions(java.lang.Object[] options,
                          int[] destinations,
                          java.lang.String[] items,
                          int room)
        Ask the user for a choice First, three things will be done:
        1. Check all possible connections available
        2. Check all possible items available
        3. Delete all connection to previous room
        If there are connections and items available, ask user if they want to stay or move to another room If there are no room connections but there are items available, ask user which item they want to pick If there are rooms available but no items, ask user to move to another room
        Parameters:
        options - object that stores the different options
        destinations - array of possible destinations
        items - array of items in room
        room - room to be deleted
        Returns:
        User choice

      • game

        public void game()
        House circuit
